I wouldn't accept this. It would break third party code if soft_wrap is enabled by default, forcing everyone to add `soft_wrap` to their print statements to be sure it would output what they expect.

If you need it, I'd suggest writing a function that calls print with soft_wrap=False.

> I wouldn't accept this. It would break third party code if soft_wrap is enabled by default, forcing everyone to add `soft_wrap` to their print statements to be sure it would output what they expect.
> 
> If you need it, I'd suggest writing a function that calls print with soft_wrap=False.

This change should not change behavior of existing code in any way. Only those that will start adding `Console(soft_wrap=True)` would be able to change behavior.

I will have another look at the code, as my main goal was to not change behavior.
